meanings.definition: A form of government in which power is held by a single individual.
meanings.sent1: In a monocracy, one person makes all the important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The monocracy of the king was absolute and unquestioned.
meanings.sent3: The monocracy of the principal over the school cafeteria led to some interesting lunch choices.
meanings.sent4: Her monocracy over the household was compared to a queen ruling her kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The monocracy of the CEO was like a captain steering a ship through stormy seas.

meanings.definition: The rule or dominion of a single person.
meanings.sent1: Living under a monocracy means one person has all the power.
meanings.sent2: The monocracy of the dictator oppressed the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The monocracy of the cat over the house was evident in how it claimed the best spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: His monocracy over the project team was akin to a general leading his troops into battle.
meanings.sent5: The monocracy of the queen bee in the hive ensured order and productivity among the worker bees.
